etymologies: Old English, from Old French tunique or Latin tunica

definitions: a loose garment, typically sleeveless and reaching to the wearer's knees, as worn in ancient Greece and Rome.
shortDefinitions: loose garment as worn in ancient Greece and Rome

definitions: a loose, thigh-length garment, worn typically by women over a skirt or trousers
shortDefinitions: loose, thigh-length garment, worn by women over skirt

definitions: a close-fitting short coat as part of a uniform, especially a police or military uniform.
shortDefinitions: close-fitting short coat as part of uniform

definitions: an integument or membrane enclosing or lining an organ or part.
shortDefinitions: integument or membrane enclosing or lining organ or part

definitions: any of the concentric layers of a plant bulb, e.g. an onion.
shortDefinitions: any of concentric layers of plant bulb

definitions: the rubbery outer coat of a sea squirt.
shortDefinitions: rubbery outer coat of sea squirt
